name: Eden Hotel Amsterdam - Hampshire Eden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Eden Hotel over the Easter period. Took the train from Amsterdam airport to the city centre and realise the hotel was at least half an hour walk through the busy main street. Alternatively, can catch the tram from the train station.
reviews.title: Comfortable but noisy

reviews.text: The interior decor is modern and the room is a reasonable size. I couldn't say the room was spotless clean as lots of hair was found the basin, a bit disgusting. It can get quite noisy at night, can hear laughters and shouts from the next room.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, hotel

likes.disliked: — Could be quite noisy at times

reviews.text: The hotel is located close to Rembrandtplein, and roughly 20 mins walk from the red light district or 30mins from the museums.
reviews.title: great place and price
Great little hotel !!!!
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Amsterdam, over the Easter period, with a friend sharing a room at the Eden Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the room to be kept very clean and comfy although a bit cosy for two adults to move around in at the same time (please take comments about *all* Nederland/European hotels having similar tiny spaces with a pinch of salt, this is a rather sweeping generalisation unless you are used to having an entire penthouse suite.)
reviews.title: had an amazing stay

likes.disliked: — didn't top up the hot chocolate/coffee sachets!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights for my stag weekend! Its close to bars and clubs and has plenty of places to eat! Its very easy to get to - take the train to Central Station from the airport (6 Euros return), then outside the train station take either the no.4 or 9 tram (3 Euros) to Rambrandt Square. When in the square cross over and walk towards the canal which will be in front of you, turn right and the hotel is about the 3rd building down on the right.
reviews.title: Great Location & Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: Check in is at 3pm, the staff are really helpful, we asked for rooms next to each other which was no problem. The rooms are excellent, very clean! They all have a safe which is free to use and flat screen TV's. They are all very modern - see photos! The hotel is also open 24 hours so no concerns as to what time you get back - your room card will allow access through the front door of the building. There is a club called Home next door to the hotel, so if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the left side of the hotel!
reviews.title: Dirty, Overpriced hotel

reviews.text: We walked everywhere, Dam Square (Red Light District) is approx 15 minute walk away, just turn left out of the hotel and follow the canal.
reviews.title: Good location, needs improvement

likes.disliked: — too small, the rooms were dark, old, and outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 nite stay and were extremely disappointed. We had to upgrade twice to an executive room for over $400 a nite to have enough room for two adults to both stand on the floor at the same time. When we got ready for bed and turned back the covers it was to find blood stained sheets and dirty pillowcases...obviously the linens had not been changed from the previous tenant. The chambermaid balked at changing the linens since it was "someone else's job." We finally got the sheets changed the next morning, but the bloody bath mat was refolded and replaced for three days straight. Even in the hotel's bar, I was served a glass of wine in a lipstick covered, sticky, obviously dirty wine glass.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: no cloth hangers in the bathroom, only 1 bar to hang a towel, quite interesting if you are 2, as only 1 towel can dry..
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: The Eden is located in a lovely part of Amsterdam and the staff are friendly. However it was one of the most basic three stars I have stayed in. Small room (with tiny bathroom) overlooked a brick wall. The beds weren't made properly and the corridors really stank of smoke (there is one non-smoking floor). Also, as previous reviewer mentioned, the sound proofing is very poor - I could here the man next door coughing all night and the squeals of the girls down the corridors coming in late from clubbing. Not a place to get a good nights sleep!
reviews.title: Great location but a very basic three star!

reviews.text: Spent two nights here last weekend. We knew nothing about the hotel previously to arriving as we were bumped from another hotel owned by the same chain.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: We found the hotel totally adequate for our needs. It is in a very convenient location (2 mins walk from Rembrandtsplein), the communal areas (reception etc) are smart, our room was quite big and was clean.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The main downside is the noise - internal sound proofing appeared non-existent so you may know more than you wish to about what your neighbours are up to.
reviews.title: Conventient Hotel

reviews.text: Also street noise during the night.
reviews.title: a far cry from what i was led to expect

reviews.text: After a night in a truly awful hotel we saught refuge at Hotel Eden. We had walked past it and had stayed at Best Western's before. They were almost sold out, but did have a room (room #117) that they offered us for $200 a night in US dollars. We assumed it would be one of their standard rooms. We got to the room and it turned out that it was an overflow room (this was later confirmed by hotel staff). It was very tired and the window overlooked a brick wall. The bathroom was better than our last hotel, but our toliet smelled like sewer and that was truly disgusting. We had to brush our teeth outside the bathroom because of the smell. We had to hold our breath while using the toliet. We didn't tell the staff about it until checking out..which was dumb because they might have been able to rectify the problem.
reviews.title: Fine, but just don't get an overflow room
Average
reviews.text: The size of the room was fine and it was clean (most important to me). It was just tired and looked like it hadn't been updated in 10 years. The wing we were in (rooms in the 100's) were the overflow rooms so I guess that was to be expected. However we felt like we should have been told that when checking in. Breakfast was not included, and we felt like we should be getting more for $200 a night.

The location was fantastic however. Right around the corner from Remblantsplein, and a very easy walk to everything else in the city. The canal that the hotel sits on is very pretty and if we had a room overlooking the canal vs. a brick wall we probably would have felt much different about the room and not minded that it was tired.
reviews.title: Fine hotel - well located

reviews.text: The staff was nice, and we asked the conceirge for advice on what canal tour to do. The location of all the Remblantspelin restaurants 1 minute away was nice. I would stay here again if I was assured that I wasn't going to have an overflow room in the overflow wing.
reviews.title: Great location shame about the rest!

reviews.text: Good size room, fairly clean and right in the center of the city and walking distance to all museums, red light, etc. Great Location.
reviews.title: A 2* minus hotel, very basic

reviews.text: The location was great, the hotel was basic but as always, you get what you pay for. Breakfast was expensive but there are good cafees in the area.
reviews.title: Good location, basic hotel

reviews.text: I wouldnt mind staying there again if I got a good rate
reviews.title: Don't be put off by other reviews

reviews.text: Although our room was VERY basic but it was clean - we were more than happy with the reception, bar and staff who were extremely friendly and helpful, making us feel very welcome. The breakfast was very good - unlimited buffet style & plenty of choice continental style with cold meats and cheeses & also scrambled eggs & bacon or sausages. Great location - the square behind the hotel had a great choice of bars and resturants - the Australian bar had a great menu and happy hour for cocktails. Enjoy your stay - we would be happy to return there - just don't expect too much from your room.
reviews.title: Worst Western Eden Hotel !!!

reviews.text: Me and my fiance spent 3 nights at this dreadful hotel in Feb 2006, it was our first visit to Amsterdam and meant to be a break with a difference away from the children..... A DIFFERENCE IS WHAT WE GOT!!!!
reviews.title: better than expected

reviews.text: The Eden has a great location and some very friendly and helpful staff. It looks great from the outside and the lobby/bar/reception are very nice indeed.
reviews.title: Below average room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the double room we were given was very disappointing. It was extremely dingy as the window looked onto a central shaft - as we were on floor one, we were at the bottom of the shaft, so even if the sun was shining brightly, it felt as if it was overcast. The room was also very small, but was relatively palatial when compared to the bathroom which barely allowed room to turn around without hitting anything. It was also difficult to get to sleep in the room as the bed was very soft and was made worse by the wall onto the corridor having zero soundproofing which meant that any loud guests walking past were clearly heard (exclusively English and Americans...). There were also random scraping sounds which lasted our entire stay, which we attributed to people in the bar downstairs. One final problem was an uninvited room guest - I'm no entomologist, but it looked like a mosquito to me. All in all, extremely disappointing for the expensive room rate - and no breakfast included! We’ve been to many hotels in Amsterdam, but we won't be returning to this one.
reviews.title: Good location to get around, but not for relaxing holiday.

reviews.text: This was my first visit to AMS,but not to Europe,so am aware of ratings.This hotel was clean,the staff was more than helpful.The location can not be beat.The hallways looked a bit well used but our room which overlooked the canal was up todate and a good size for a 3star European hotel.I hope when they open up their new place around the corner ,they keep this as the view is fantastic,we booked this several months in advance and had a good rate from BW and we had to pay 20euro extra for the view but for us its worth it.

reviews.text: We did not eat at the restaurant but the staff suggested nearby restaurants which were excellent.The bar staff very kindly opened our self bought wine bottles which we consumed in our room and in fact told us where to buy them and beer which the beer, at least they sold in vending machines but suggested we but it elsewhere for less.All in all a great hotel
reviews.title: Great value for money & excellent location

reviews.text: I stayed here 2 years ago and whilst I knew that the rooms can be shabby, due to the location and an excellent deal at $70 per night (inl breakfast) I thought it was worth the money. We seem to have lucked out though and got a far superior room to the one we had before (or they've just decorated!)and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: skip this place
Basic Accomodation, Great Location
reviews.text: If you want an average 3* which is definitely a hotel and not a hostel, I would recommend and stay here again.

reviews.title: Not so mice!!!
reviews.text: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel. I also stayed here Dec. 2003. In two years this place fell apart. They are building a new hotel that will face the square. They had banners that said it was to be completed in 2005 but it was far from being done. Our room for 3 people was worn out with bleach stains and holes in the carpeting. It was so dirty that we couldn't take off our shoes. The construction pounding went on all day. The walls are paper thin and we heard all the activities of the young couple next door. Didn't get much sleep that night! The breakfast went down hill too. We paid $125 usd so the price was good for Amsterdam but I wouldn't stay there again. I like the location. There are a few other hotels in the same square I will try next visit. Loved Amsterdam!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the end of May. They were apparently having unseasonably warm weather in Amsterdam the two days that we were in town, and it was unfortunate that the window in our hotel room only opened a couple of inches. The room location was on the side of the building and faced other buildings with balconies, and at night, and into the early morning, people would sit on the balconies and talk rather loudly. As if the heat didn't make it difficult to sleep, the constant voices was very distracting. (Try to request a room in the front of the hotel, if possible.) However, this hotel is in a very convenient location. A very short walk to the Rembrandtplein tram stop and within walking distance of many restaurants and bars. The room is very basic, but if you're not too picky, the price is right. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway so it wasn't that big a deal. The bathroom was clean and modern. The staff was fairly helpful. Overall, not a terrible experience, and if it weren't so hot, which isn't normal anyway, it would probably have been very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Very basic hotel for good price.
Prison cell at Eden Hotel
reviews.text: If you plan to get a museum pass when you arrive, there is a place in the Central Station that sells them. I recommend buying it there rather than the tourist office across from Central Station. Much shorter line and less chaotic. Also, to get to this hotel, take tram 4 or 9 from Central Station. It will drop you at Rembrandtplein and then you just need to duck through the alley (towards the canal) in front of the tram stop to get to the hotel. Once facing the canal, go right. The hotel is just a few buildings down.

Three women friends and I stayed at the Best Western Eden Hotel for three days at the end of April 2005. Our rooms had all the charm of a prison cell. The carpet was stained, the bathroom tile grout was dirty and the formica table top was chipped. The complex system of elevators and labyrinth of hallways was very confusing. The only good thing I can say is that the bed was okay. We were there during the Queen's Day celebration, and the music was so loud that we did not sleep at all that night. Even my friend with the major earplugs couldn't sleep. It sounded like we had loud speakers in our rooms. The best thing I can say about this hotel was that it was inexpensive compared to other Amsterdam hotels. At 110 euros per night, it was still a bad deal. And the pictures looked great on line! I would not ever stay here again, and am writing Best Western to complain.
reviews.title: lovely, just what you need

reviews.text: if you are looking to stay somewhere pleasant but not too posh then this place is in a great location and not badly priced. we asked for a room with a view over the canal and it had great large windows for us to look out of.brekkie was nice and the bar at the front of the hotel was a nice atmosphere. For most people going to amsterdam, this place would be entirely suitable and in a great location. (quiet, just off rembrantsplain) if your looking for a plush pad, then go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in Amsterdam for 3 days. The location is great...outdoor bars, nightclubs, and of course "coffee shops" are just around the corner. The hotel is situated right in front of cool canal, and a beautiful bridge. The hotel staff was VERY friendly. Our room was clean, the bathroom big, (watch out, the water in Holland heats up really fast!! You'll burn your face off if your're not careful!!!). It was very noisy outside, and a train station was nearby, but the windows were pretty thick...so we were not bothered at all. You get what you pay for...if you're on a budget, but can afford to stay in something better than a hostel...this is a GREAT deal. Overall, I would give this hotel an A-. Have fun in Amsterdam!! :)
reviews.title: This place is great!

reviews.text: The hotel is undergoing substanial building works and its noisy from 7am in the morning. There is also works going on outside in the street that will be present for a while.
